title: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
description: Traditional Roman pasta dish with eggs, cheese, and pancetta. Simple yet incredibly flavorful.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti until al dente.
In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, both cheeses, and black pepper.
Cook pancetta in a large skillet until crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta water, then drain pasta.
Add hot pasta to the skillet with pancetta and toss.
Remove from heat and quickly add egg mixture, tossing constantly.
Add pasta water gradually until sauce is creamy.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.

title: Penne all'Arrabbiata
description: Spicy Roman pasta with tomatoes, garlic, and red pepper flakes. Perfect for those who love heat.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add garlic and red pepper flakes, cook until fragrant.
Add crushed tomatoes, season with salt.
Simmer sauce for 15-20 minutes until thickened.
Cook penne in salted boiling water until al dente.
Drain pasta and add to the sauce.
Toss well and cook for 2 minutes.
Garnish with parsley and serve with cheese.

title: Fettuccine Alfredo
description: Rich and creamy pasta dish with butter, cream, and Parmesan cheese. Pure indulgence.
ingredients: Salt and white pepper to taste
instructions: Cook fettuccine in salted boiling water until al dente.
Meanwhile, melt butter in a large pan over medium heat.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in cream and bring to a gentle simmer.
Drain pasta, reserving 1/2 cup pasta water.
Add pasta to the cream sauce and toss.
Gradually add Parmesan cheese, tossing constantly.
Add pasta water if needed for consistency.
Season with salt and pepper, garnish with parsley.

title: Lasagna Bolognese
description: Classic layered pasta with rich meat sauce, béchamel, and cheese. A true Italian comfort food.
instructions: Make Bolognese: sauté vegetables, add meat, wine, and tomatoes. Simmer 1 hour.
Make béchamel: melt butter, add flour, gradually whisk in milk until thick.
Cook lasagna sheets until al dente, drain and lay flat.
Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Layer: meat sauce, pasta, béchamel, cheese. Repeat 3 times.
Top with remaining cheese.
Bake covered for 45 minutes, then uncovered for 15 minutes.
Let rest 10 minutes before serving.

title: Orecchiette con Cime di Rapa
description: Traditional Pugliese pasta with turnip greens, garlic, and anchovies. Simple and delicious.
instructions: Clean and chop turnip greens, separating leaves and stems.
Boil stems for 5 minutes, add leaves and cook 3 more minutes.
Remove greens, keep water for pasta.
Cook orecchiette in the same water until al dente.
Heat oil in large pan, add garlic and anchovies.
Add greens and red pepper flakes, sauté 3 minutes.
Add drained pasta to the pan with greens.
Toss well, add cheese and serve immediately.

title: Risotto ai Funghi Porcini
description: Creamy Arborio rice with porcini mushrooms and Parmesan. Northern Italian comfort food.
instructions: Soak porcini in warm water for 20 minutes, reserve liquid.
Heat oil and half the butter in heavy-bottomed pan.
Sauté onion until soft, add garlic and fresh mushrooms.
Add rice, stir for 2 minutes until grains are coated.
Add wine, stir until absorbed.
Add warm stock one ladle at a time, stirring constantly.
Add porcini and their liquid halfway through cooking.
Cook 18-20 minutes until rice is creamy but al dente.
Stir in remaining butter and Parmesan, season and serve.

title: Spaghetti alle Vongole
description: Neapolitan pasta with fresh clams, white wine, and parsley. Taste of the Mediterranean sea.
instructions: Soak clams in salt water for 30 minutes to purge sand.
Heat oil in large pan, add garlic and red pepper flakes.
Add clams and white wine, cover and cook until they open.
Remove clams, strain and reserve cooking liquid.
Remove clam meat from most shells, keep some whole for garnish.
Cook spaghetti until almost al dente.
Add pasta to the pan with clam liquid.
Add clam meat, parsley, and finish cooking.
Serve immediately with whole clams on top.

title: Ravioli di Ricotta e Spinaci
description: Homemade pasta parcels filled with ricotta and spinach, served with sage butter sauce.
instructions: Make pasta: combine flour and eggs, knead until smooth. Rest 30 minutes.
Cook spinach, squeeze dry, and chop finely.
Mix ricotta, spinach, half the Parmesan, egg yolk, nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
Roll pasta thin, cut into squares.
Place filling on squares, brush edges with water, fold and seal.
Cook ravioli in salted boiling water for 3-4 minutes until they float.
Meanwhile, melt butter with sage until golden and fragrant.
Drain ravioli and toss gently with sage butter.
Serve with remaining Parmesan cheese.

title: Bucatini all'Amatriciana
description: Roman pasta with guanciale, tomatoes, and pecorino. One of the classic Roman pasta dishes.
instructions: Cook guanciale in a large pan until crispy and golden.
Add red pepper flakes and cook for 30 seconds.
Add crushed tomatoes and simmer for 15 minutes.
Cook bucatini in salted boiling water until al dente.
Reserve pasta water and drain pasta.
Add pasta to the sauce and toss well.
Add pasta water if needed for consistency.
Remove from heat, add half the cheese and toss.
Serve with remaining cheese and black pepper.

title: Linguine al Pesto Genovese
description: Fresh basil pesto with pine nuts and Parmesan, tossed with linguine. Pure Ligurian tradition.
instructions: Toast pine nuts in a dry pan until golden, let cool.
In a food processor, pulse garlic and salt until minced.
Add basil leaves and pine nuts, pulse to combine.
With processor running, slowly add olive oil.
Transfer to bowl, stir in both cheeses by hand.
Cook linguine until al dente, reserve 1/2 cup pasta water.
Drain pasta and return to pot.
Add pesto and pasta water gradually, tossing well.
Serve immediately with extra cheese if desired.

title: Cacio e Pepe
description: Minimalist Roman pasta with just pecorino cheese and black pepper. Simple perfection.
instructions: Cook spaghetti in abundant salted water until al dente.
Toast black pepper in a large pan for 1 minute.
Add 1/2 cup pasta water to the pan with pepper.
Drain pasta, reserving 2 cups of pasta water.
Add pasta to the pan and toss vigorously.
Remove from heat, gradually add cheese while tossing.
Add pasta water as needed to create a silky sauce.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and pepper.

title: Pasta alla Puttanesca
description: Bold Neapolitan pasta with tomatoes, olives, capers, and anchovies. Full of Mediterranean flavors.
instructions: Heat oil in large pan, add garlic and anchovies.
Cook until anchovies dissolve, about 2 minutes.
Add red pepper flakes, olives, and capers.
Add crushed tomatoes and simmer 15 minutes.
Cook spaghetti until al dente.
Drain and add to the sauce.
Toss well and cook for 1 minute.
Garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

title: Tortellini in Brodo
description: Hand-shaped pasta parcels in rich chicken broth. Classic comfort food from Emilia-Romagna.
instructions: Make pasta dough, knead until smooth, rest 30 minutes.
Cook pork until browned, let cool and mix with prosciutto.
Add Parmesan, egg, nutmeg, salt, and pepper to meat.
Roll pasta very thin, cut into small squares.
Place small amount of filling on each square.
Fold into triangles, then wrap around finger to form tortellini.
Heat chicken stock to a gentle simmer.
Cook tortellini in simmering stock for 3-5 minutes.
Serve in bowls with hot broth and extra Parmesan.

title: Pasta alla Norma
description: Sicilian pasta with eggplant, tomatoes, and ricotta salata. A celebration of Sicilian flavors.
instructions: Salt diced eggplant and let drain for 30 minutes.
Rinse and pat dry the eggplant.
Fry eggplant in olive oil until golden, drain on paper towels.
In same pan, cook garlic until fragrant.
Add tomatoes, season, and simmer 20 minutes.
Cook rigatoni until al dente.
Add eggplant back to tomato sauce.
Drain pasta and toss with sauce.
Serve with ricotta salata and fresh basil.

title: Gnocchi di Patate al Pomodoro
description: Soft potato dumplings with simple tomato sauce. Comfort food from Northern Italy.
instructions: Boil potatoes with skin until tender, peel while hot.
Pass through ricer or mash until smooth, let cool slightly.
Mix potatoes with flour, egg, and salt to form dough.
Roll into long ropes and cut into small pieces.
Roll each piece over fork tines to create ridges.
Make tomato sauce: cook garlic in oil, add tomatoes, simmer 15 minutes.
Cook gnocchi in boiling salted water until they float.
Drain and toss with tomato sauce.
Serve with basil and Parmesan cheese.

title: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
description: Midnight pasta with garlic, olive oil, and red pepper flakes. Simple ingredients, perfect execution.
instructions: Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente.
Meanwhile, heat oil in large pan over medium-low heat.
Add garlic and red pepper flakes, cook until garlic is golden.
Don't let garlic burn - adjust heat as needed.
Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water, then drain pasta.
Add pasta to the garlic oil and toss vigorously.
Add pasta water gradually to help emulsify.
Remove from heat, add parsley and toss.
Serve immediately, with cheese if desired.

title: Farfalle con Salmone e Panna
description: Bow-tie pasta with smoked salmon in creamy sauce. Elegant and delicious.
instructions: Cook farfalle until al dente, reserve pasta water.
Sauté onion in butter until translucent.
Add white wine and cook until reduced by half.
Pour in cream and bring to gentle simmer.
Add smoked salmon and heat through gently.
Drain pasta and add to the cream sauce.
Toss gently, adding pasta water if needed.
Season with pepper, garnish with dill and lemon zest.
Serve immediately.

title: Pasta e Fagioli
description: Hearty pasta and bean soup from Veneto. Perfect comfort food for cold days.
instructions: Heat oil in large pot, sauté onion, carrot, and celery until soft.
Add tomatoes, beans, stock, bay leaves, and Parmesan rind.
Bring to boil, then simmer 30 minutes.
Mash half the beans for thickness.
Add pasta and cook until tender.
Season with salt, pepper, and rosemary.
Let rest 5 minutes before serving.
Drizzle with olive oil and serve with crusty bread.

title: Paccheri con Melanzane
description: Large tube pasta with eggplant, tomatoes, and mozzarella. Southern Italian comfort.
instructions: Salt eggplant cubes and let drain 30 minutes.
Rinse and dry eggplant, then fry until golden.
Cook garlic in olive oil until fragrant.
Add tomatoes, season, and simmer 20 minutes.
Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Cook paccheri until very al dente.
Mix pasta with tomato sauce, eggplant, and mozzarella.
Transfer to baking dish, top with Parmesan.
Bake 20 minutes until golden and bubbly.
Garnish with fresh basil before serving.

title: Tagliatelle al Ragù Bolognese
description: Fresh egg pasta with the classic meat sauce from Bologna. The ultimate comfort food.
instructions: Cook pancetta until crispy, remove and set aside.
Sauté vegetables in pancetta fat until soft.
Add ground meats, cook until browned.
Add wine and cook until evaporated.
Stir in tomato paste, cook 2 minutes.
Add tomatoes, stock, bay leaves, and pancetta.
Simmer very gently for 2.5-3 hours, stirring occasionally.
Add milk in last 30 minutes of cooking.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cook tagliatelle until al dente, toss with sauce.
Serve with Parmesan cheese.
